info.title: Squidex API
info.description:
# Introduction

The API provides two specifications. The Content API usually returns one object per schema field where the keys are the languages (or `iv` for non-localized) fields and the values are the actual field values.

You can use the `X-Flatten` header to return a flat structure when you query content items. This is more performant and easier for code generation. Unfortunantely it cannot be modelled with OpenAPI. Therefore we provide two different documents for your API.

Read more about this here: https://docs.squidex.io/02-documentation/concepts/localization#how-to-use-the-api

## Normal Content API

All content fields are objects in the response.

Go to: https://squidex.thepk.in/api/content/platform/docs/

## Flat Content API

All content fields are single values.

Go to: https://squidex.thepk.in/api/content/platform/docs/flat/

get.description:
How to make queries?

Read more about it at: https://docs.squidex.io/04-guides/02-api.html

The query endpoints support three options:

### Query with OData

Squidex supports a subset of the OData (https://www.odata.org/) syntax with with the following query options:

* **$top**: The $top query option requests the number of items in the queried collection to be included in the result. The default value is 20 and the maximum allowed value is 200. You can change the maximum in the app settings, when you host Squidex yourself.
* **$skip**: The $skip query option requests the number of items in the queried collection that are to be skipped and not included in the result. Use it together with $top to read the all your data page by page. 
* **$search**: The $search query option allows clients to request entities matching a free-text search expression. We add the data of all fields for all languages to our full text engine.
* **$filter**: The $filter query option allows clients to filter a collection of resources that are addressed by a request URL.
* **$orderby**: The $orderby query option allows clients to request resources in a particular order.

### Query with JSON query

Squidex also supports a query syntax based on JSON. You have to pass in the query object as query parameter:

* **q**: A json text that represents the same query options as with OData, but is more performant to parse.

### Query by IDs

Query your items by passing in one or many IDs with the following query parameter:

* **ids**: A comma-separated list of ids. If you define this option all other settings are ignored.

parameters.name: $search
parameters.description: Optional number of items to skip.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Optional number of items to take.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Optional number of items to skip.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Optional OData order definition.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Optional OData filter.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: JSON query as well formatted json string. Overrides all other query parameters, except 'ids'.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma separated list of object IDs. Overrides all other query parameters.

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Set to true to autopublish content on create.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The optional custom content ID.

requestBody.description:
The data of the content.
            
Please note that each field is an object with one entry per language. 
If the field is not localizable you must use `iv` (invariant language) as a key.

Read more about it at: https://docs.squidex.io/04-guides/02-api.html

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the objec.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the object (usually GUID).

parameters.name: patch
parameters.description: Makes the update as patch.

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Set to true to autopublish content on create.

parameters.name: enrichDefaults
parameters.description: Enrich the content with defaults.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the object (usually GUID).

requestBody.description:
The data of the content.
            
Please note that each field is an object with one entry per language. 
If the field is not localizable you must use `iv` (invariant language) as a key.

Read more about it at: https://docs.squidex.io/04-guides/02-api.html

parameters.name: enrichDefaults
parameters.description: Enrich the content with defaults.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the object (usually GUID).

requestBody.description:
The data of the content.
            
Please note that each field is an object with one entry per language. 
If the field is not localizable you must use `iv` (invariant language) as a key.

Read more about it at: https://docs.squidex.io/04-guides/02-api.html

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the object (usually GUID).

requestBody.description:
The data of the content.
            
Please note that each field is an object with one entry per language. 
If the field is not localizable you must use `iv` (invariant language) as a key.

Read more about it at: https://docs.squidex.io/04-guides/02-api.html

parameters.name: permanent
parameters.description: True when the entity should be deleted permanently.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the object (usually GUID).

get.summary: Get a 'about' content item by id and version.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the objec.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the object (usually GUID).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the object (usually GUID).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the object (usually GUID).

put.summary: Change the status of a 'about' content item.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the object (usually GUID).

requestBody.description: The request to change content status.

post.summary: Bulk update content items across all schemas.

checkReferrers.description: True to check referrers of this content.

jobs.description: The contents to update or insert.

publish.description: True to automatically publish the content.

doNotScript.description: True to turn off scripting for faster inserts. Default: true.

enrichRequiredFields.description: True, to also enrich required fields. Default: false.

doNotValidate.description: True to turn off validation for faster inserts. Default: false.

doNotValidateWorkflow.description: True to turn off validation of workflow rules. Default: false.

checkReferrers.description: True to check referrers of deleted contents.

optimizeValidation.description: True to turn off costly validation: Unique checks, asset checks and reference checks. Default: true.

query.description: An optional query to identify the content to update.

id.description: An optional ID of the content to update.

data.description: The data of the content when type is set to 'Upsert', 'Create', 'Update' or 'Patch.

status.description: The new status when the type is set to 'ChangeStatus' or 'Upsert'.

schema.description: The optional schema id or name.

permanent.description: True to delete the content permanently.

enrichDefaults.description: Enrich the data with the default values when updating a content item.

expectedCount.description: The number of expected items. Set it to a higher number to update multiple items when a query is defined.

error.description: The error when the bulk job failed.

jobIndex.description: The index of the bulk job where the result belongs to. The order can change.

id.description: The ID of the entity that has been handled successfully or not.

contentId.description: The ID of the entity that has been handled successfully or not.

statusCode.description: Status code of the http response.

ids.description: The optional list of ids to query.

squidex-oauth-auth.description:
Squidex uses OpenId Connect (OIDC) with the Client Credentials Flow (defined in OAuth 2.0 RFC 6749, section 4.4).

The OpenId Connect Client Credentials flow can be used for machine to machine authentication. In this grant a specific user is not authorized but rather the credentials are verified and a generic `access_token` is returned.

The `access_token` is a signed JSON Web Token (JWT) which contains expiry information. 

To retrieve an access token you must pass the Client ID and Client Secret to the token endpoint to authenticate yourself and get a token:

    $ curl
        -X POST 'https://squidex.thepk.in/identity-server/connect/token' 
        -H 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' 
        -d 'grant_type=client_credentials&
            client_id=[CLIENT_ID]&
            client_secret=[CLIENT_SECRET]&
			scope=squidex-api'

Pass this token to all consecutiv requests to the API via the `Authorization` header:

     Authorization: Bearer <token>
